alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Koyukuk Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 30 at 9:47AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Including the following areas, Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys and Upper Koyukuk Valley and Brooks Range from the Dalton Highway west. This includes the cities of Ambler, Shungnak, Kobuk, Wiseman, Coldfoot, Iniakuk Lake, Allakaket, Hughes, Bettles. * WHEN...Through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff from heavy rain may result in flooding of smaller rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. At this time, flooding of the mainstem of the Koyukuk, Noatak and Kobuk Rivers is not expected, but those rivers will see sharp rises this week. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Between 1 and 2 inches of rain has fallen over the past several days over the Upper Noatak Valley, the Kobuk Valley, and the Koyukuk Valley and Brooks Range from the Dalton Highway west. Another 0.75 to 1.5 inches of rain is expected over these same areas through early tomorrow. Streams and smaller rivers in these basins are already running high, and the additional rain could push them overbank over the next several days. Flooding of low lying areas is possible between today and Tuesday. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Koyukuk Valley
